column4: Hi can anybody help me please, my external is not being mounted, it's formatted to ext3
my sudo fdisk -l see it
how to mount it?
well, that does not really seem like ext3, is it? It says NTFS
I thought i formatted it to ext3
Something is wrong
Yes, so I can tell you how to mount it using NTFS, but maybe you want to format it ext3 anyway?
I used partition manager to format it to ext3, but now i see it's still ntfs. well suku, my objective is to format it to XFS
I tried to used gparted live cd, but it could see it
Suku, that's the reason I tried to format it to ext3 first, now I see it's not been done
Ok, is there a way to run gparted from ubuntu directly?
yes. System menu > administration > partition editor
ocean and suku, I see it now from the drop down menu. But unfortunately the XFS is grey out
how to do that?
suku it is called "xfsprogs", and yes it is in the repos
got it now, downloading it
thanks guys, downloaded it already and installed, last thing, how to run the xfs program?
program?
xfs tools?
on commandline do a "dpkg -L xfsprogs" and you will see all related commands. Like xfs_copy, xfs_admin, xfs_check etc
